      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(java.lang.Object vertexA,
                    java.lang.Object vertexB,
                    java.lang.Object data)
             throws DuplicateEntryException,
                    AlreadyHasAdjacency,
                    InexistentVertexException,
                    LoopIsNotAllowedException
        Method that add an Edge between two vertices.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface IGraph
        Parameters:
        vertexA - The first Vertex.
        vertexB - The second Vertex.
        data - The weight of the Edge.
        Throws:
        DuplicateEntryException
        AlreadyHasAdjacency - If there's already an Edge between the vertices informed.
        InexistentVertexException - If some of two vertices doesn't exist in the Graph.
        LoopIsNotAllowedException - If the two vertices are the same.
